MAN.TITLE: seteventhandler
MAN.SHORT_DESCRIPTION: set an event handler for the current graphic window

PARAM_DESCRIPTION.SP: : a character string. The name of the Scilab function which is intended to handle the events

DESCRIPTION.P: The function allows the user to set a particular event handler for the current graphic window. seteventhandler('') removes the handler.
The event handler is defined by a Scilab function whose calling sequence must be function sfun_name(win,x,y,ibut), where

DESCRIPTION_ITEM.P: win represents the number of the window where the event had occured.
x,y are the coordinates of the pointer (in pixels), when the event has occured

ITEM.label: ibut==0
ITEM.SP: : Left mouse button has been pressed

ITEM.label: ibut==-5
ITEM.SP: : Left mouse button has been released

ITEM.label: ibut==1
ITEM.SP: : Middle mouse button has been pressed

ITEM.label: ibut==-4
ITEM.SP: : Middle mouse button has been released

ITEM.label: ibut==2
ITEM.SP: : Right mouse button has been pressed

ITEM.label: ibut==-3
ITEM.SP: : Right mouse button has been released

ITEM.label: ibut > =32
ITEM.SP: : key with ascii code ascii(ibut) has been pressed

ITEM.label: ibut < =-32
ITEM.SP: : key with ascii code ascii(-ibut) has been released

MAN.EXAMPLE: function my_eventhandler(win,x,y,ibut) if ibut==-1 then [x,y]=xchange(x,y,'i2f') xinfo('Mouse position is ('+string(x)+','+string(y)+')') end endfunction plot2d() seteventhandler('my_eventhandler') //now move the mouse over the graphic window/ seteventhandler('') //suppress the event handler
